title: 7 Simple Ways to Put Your Hair in a Claw Clip

steps.title: Pull your hair back toward the back of your head.
steps.content: Pull your hair back toward the back of your head. Claw clips are super easy to use, explains Miranda, “because all you have to really do is just secure your hair.” [1] X Expert Source Janet Miranda Professional Hair Stylist & Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 February 2021. For the absolute easiest version of a cute claw clip style , take all the hair from the front of your face and pull it backward. Using each hand on its respective side of your face, keep collecting hair as you move your hands backwards so that you end up with all of your hair gathered at the back of your head. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Lift and twist your hair so that the ends are pointing toward the ceiling.
steps.content: Lift and twist your hair so that the ends are pointing toward the ceiling. Gather the entire section of your hair—all of which should be pulled behind your shoulders—in one hand. Lift this hair upwards so that the ends are pointing up, twisting gently to tighten the locks against your scalp. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place a claw clip at the top of the lifted section to secure it.
steps.content: Place a claw clip at the top of the lifted section to secure it. Open your claw clip and position it where the lifted hair meets the top of your head. Let the rest of the hair (above the claw clip) fall loosely over the clip. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Twist all of your hair up into a messy bun at the back of your head.
steps.content: Twist all of your hair up into a messy bun at the back of your head. Grab all of your hair in one hand and gather it into a messy bun , begins Miranda. [5] X Expert Source Janet Miranda Professional Hair Stylist & Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 February 2021. Let the bun sit at the center of the back of your head (rather than at the top). Let some pieces fall out and scrunch your bun to create a more untidy look if necessary—remember to put the messy in the messy bun!

steps.title: Secure your bun at the nape of your neck with a claw clip.
steps.content: Secure your bun at the nape of your neck with a claw clip. At about the nape of your neck, or wherever the biggest section of your bun is, fasten a claw clip around your hair, Miranda instructs. [6] X Expert Source Janet Miranda Professional Hair Stylist & Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 February 2021. If you have very thick or long hair, you may need to use an XL claw clip in order to secure your bun fully. Pull out some strands for a messier, imperfect look.

steps.title: Start by brushing your hair.
steps.content: Start by brushing your hair . Get rid of any knots first, or the clip may get stuck. Gently move a comb or hairbrush through your strands until there are no tangles left. Brushing out your hair is especially important for long or thick hair. Once your hair is tangle-free, continue to the steps below. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Place the palms of your hands underneath your hair and gather it together.
steps.content: Place the palms of your hands underneath your hair and gather it together. Place one hand on either side of your head. Push your hands together slightly to gather your hair into one large section between your hands. Keep your hands in this position, with your palms upward and your thumbs on top of the gathered hair. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Twist your hair as you lift it up against the back of your head.
steps.content: Twist your hair as you lift it up against the back of your head. Use your hands to push your gathered hair up, but gently twist the hair in one direction as you go. You can do a quarter- or half-twist if you have thinner hair that you’d like to wear in a loose style. If you have thicker hair that you want to wear in a tight style, you can do several complete twists. Either way, twist your hair in one single section until it rests snugly against the back of your head. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the center of the twist with your claw clip.
steps.content: Secure the center of the twist with your claw clip. Open the claw clip and place it in the approximate center of the twist. Let it snap shut so that the bottom portion of the twist is secured while the ends cascade over the top of the clip. You should then have your clipped French twist, which is one of Miranda’s recommended styles for claw clips! [10] X Expert Source Janet Miranda Professional Hair Stylist & Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 February 2021. If you want a larger spray of hair over the clip, hold the ends and open the clip slightly with your other hand. Gently pull your hair upward, then close the clip again.

steps.title: Gather all of your hair into a ponytail.
steps.content: Gather all of your hair into a ponytail. Make a ponytail that sits comfortably at the back of your head. Secure the ponytail with a hair tie. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Twist the ponytail into a tight and smooth coil with the tip tucked under.
steps.content: Twist the ponytail into a tight and smooth coil with the tip tucked under. Grab your ponytail so that the end of it is pointing up at the ceiling. Starting at the base, Miranda instructs, twist the loose hair in one direction until it creates a tidy coil against your scalp. [12] X Expert Source Janet Miranda Professional Hair Stylist & Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 February 2021. Bring the tip of the ponytail back down and tuck it under the base of the twist. [13] X Research source If you have longer hair, you may need to fold and tuck your hair several times as you twist it.

steps.title: Secure the ponytail coil with a claw clip.
steps.content: Secure the ponytail coil with a claw clip. Open a claw clip and position it over the coil you just created. Let the clip close to firmly secure the style, explains Miranda. [14] X Expert Source Janet Miranda Professional Hair Stylist & Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 February 2021.

steps.title: Pull the top section of your hair to the back of your head.
steps.content: Pull the top section of your hair to the back of your head. Place your hands on either side of your head. Moving your hands backward, collect hair from the top half of your head (i.e., roughly all of the hair that grows above your ears). [15] X Research source

steps.title: Secure this section at the back of your head with a claw clip.
steps.content: Secure this section at the back of your head with a claw clip. Now that you’ve gathered the top section of your hair, hold it at the center of the back of your head. Then, clip the claw clip around it to hold it in place, Miranda instructs. [16] X Expert Source Janet Miranda Professional Hair Stylist & Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 February 2021. Let the bottom half of your hair hang loose, just as if you were wearing your hair down. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Gather the back portion of your hair and secure it with a claw clip.
steps.content: Gather the back portion of your hair and secure it with a claw clip. Use your hands to sweep together only the hair that grows on the back of your head. Place your first claw clip at the very bottom of your head to secure that section. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the rest of your hair backward and clip it below the first section.
steps.content: Pull the rest of your hair backward and clip it below the first section. Gather the rest of your hair from the front and sides of your head. Pull it backward and under the already-clipped section. Place your second clip about 2 inches (51 mm) below the first one to secure the newly-gathered section. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Pull nearly all of your hair to the back of your head.
steps.content: Pull nearly all of your hair to the back of your head. Gather all of your hair in your hands and pull it behind your shoulders. Center this section of hair behind your neck, almost as if you’re going to make a low pony (but without fastening it with a hair tie). [20] X Research source Optionally, you can leave out one or two face-framing strands at the front of your hair.

steps.title: Apply a hair pomade to smooth out the lengths of your hair.
steps.content: Apply a hair pomade to smooth out the lengths of your hair. Put a small amount of hair pomade in your hands. Work the pomade through the loose ends of your hair that are sitting behind your neck. The pomade will give your hair a polished, sleek, and frizz-free final look. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the ponytail with a claw clip at the nape of your neck.
steps.content: Secure the ponytail with a claw clip at the nape of your neck. Collect your hair again so that it’s sitting like a low pony behind your neck. Instead of securing it with a hair tie, however, clip a cute claw clip at the nape of your neck. Make sure that all of your hair (besides the face-framing pieces) is secured by the clip.
